title: Las Vegas theme
content:
Any ideas for headline fonts that suggest Las Vegas?

A client is having a conference there and I'm preparing materials for a party event, so flamboyant or even tacky is okay (but more subtle looks are fine too as long as they suggest the city). Thanks.
author: JamesM

comments.content:
There's this subtly named collection from House Industries:  
 [http://www.houseind.com/fonts/lasvegasfonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20150318013427/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/lasvegasfonts "http://www.houseind.com/fonts/lasvegasfonts")

> so flamboyant or even tacky is okay

Right up my alley!

I'd do up something in some design software, but if you want something ready made you could go with a neon-esque font...

[http://www.dafont.com/neon-lights.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20150318013427/http:/www.dafont.com/neon-lights.font "http://www.dafont.com/neon-lights.font")

Or, how about something triline...

[http://www.myfonts.com/search/triline/fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150318013427/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/triline/fonts/ "http://www.myfonts.com/search/triline/fonts/")

...something inline...

[http://www.myfonts.com/search/inline/fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150318013427/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/inline/fonts/ "http://www.myfonts.com/search/inline/fonts/")

Prismatic would be fun.

What pt sizes are you using? Vegas is a dynamic town!!!

Odd we didn't make an appearance on your request - [http://www.fontdiner.com/menu\_vegas.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150318013427/http:/www.fontdiner.com/menu_vegas.html "http://www.fontdiner.com/menu\_vegas.html")
You’ll have to do better with Google, Stuart—“Las Vegas Font” pulls up various freebies and House Industries, but no Font Diner (at least, not on the ﬁrst page).
